refnamediv.refpurpose: generate viewpoint animation between two points

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Rtwalk generates a viewpoint animation control script that takes the eye between given start and end points, without walking through any geometry. The model geometry is the list of objects in the input database model.g. The primary output is in the form of an old-format RT viewpoint animation control script (which is also suitable for input to the MGED "rmat" command) in the file "rtwalk.mat".

listitem.para: Set rtwalk debug flags to (hexadecimal) number. A flag value of 1 causes 3-D plot output to be written to stdout. All solid RPPs are plotted as grey boxes, and the walk path is in alternating blue and green segments. A flag value of 2 adds red segments for all attempted steps, as well as the final steps. A flag value of 3 adds some debugging prints to stderr in addition to the plots. This is useful for immediate path review, e.g.,
Set librt debug flags to (hexadecimal) number.

refsect1.para: The rtwalk program employs librt3 for the geometry interrogation. This program is currently in fledgling form, and is likely to evolve into an important tool for motion path generation and validation, interference checking in part articulation, and numerically controlled milling.

refsect1.title: DIAGNOSTICS
refsect1.para: Numerous error conditions are possible. Descriptive messages are printed on standard error.

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: Most deficiencies observed while using the rtwalk program are usually with the librt3 package instead.
